executive_summary: Sanket Gaikwad is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, currently exhibiting an HbA1c of 7.5%, which is above the target of 7.0%. His blood pressure is well-controlled at 120/80 mmHg, and he has no significant complications or comorbidities at this time. Priorities include optimizing glycemic control and implementing lifestyle modifications.

clinical_context.recent_events: No recent episodes of hypoglycemia or DKA

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c of 7.5% indicates suboptimal glycemic control.
interpretation.plan: Implement lifestyle modifications and consider medication for better glycemic control.

interpretation.assessment: LDL level of 2.5 is above the target for high-risk patients.
interpretation.plan: Advise dietary changes and consider lipid-lowering therapy.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise weekly.
Aim for a balanced diet rich in whole grains, fruits, and vegetables.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on a low glycemic index diet, reduce saturated fats, and control portion sizes.
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use smaller plates to help control portion sizes.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels between 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia.

patient_goals: Achieve HbA1c of less than 7.0% within 6 months.
Reduce LDL to below 2.0 mmol/L within 6 months.
Increase physical activity to 150 minutes per week within 3 months.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy to improve glycemic control.
Consider statin therapy for LDL management.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c, LDL levels, and overall management plan.

emr_note: Patient is a 43-year-old male with T1DM, HbA1c at 7.5%. Lifestyle modifications and potential medication adjustments discussed. Follow-up in 3 months.
